titleStmt.title: The Sanskrit Fragments Or.15004 in the Hoernle Collection
titleStmt.author: Wille, Klaus

sourceDesc.p: Klaus Wille, “The Sanskrit Fragments Or.15004 in the Hoernle Collection,” in: Buddhist Manuscripts from Central Asia: The British Library Sanskrit Fragments, Volume II.1 (Texts), ed. by Seishi KARASHIMA and Klaus WILLE, Tokyo: The International Research Institute for Advanced Buddhology at Soka University, 2009, pp. 73-104.

encodingDesc.editorialDecl: Input and marked up by IRIAB.

head.p: This catalogue contains transliterations of Sanskrit fragments in the Stein Collection at the British Library.

msItem.title: Pravāraṇasūtra
msItem.note: cf. Pell.Skt. Rouge 14.3, fol. (114) (not yet ed.) and SHT 24 frg. Lüders h (not yet ed; First transliteration by Else Lüders.)

msItem.q:
1 (r)[h](a)[t]i [kā]yika(ṃ) [v]āvā[c]ika[ṃ v]āc[ai]ta[s]i[k]. ///
2 ṣāṃ [bhad](a)n[t]a pa[ṃcānāṃ] bhikṣ[u] ◯ ///
3 ri .. .. [pa]ñ[c]ā[nāṃ bhi]kṣuśa ◯ ///
4 vī [śā]ripu[tra bhik]ṣusa[ṃgha]ḥ ◯ ///
5 + [ṣaṃ]ṇo ’bhū[t] s(aṃ)ni[p](a)titaḥ a[th]. + + + ///

msItem.note: there seem to be at least two different fragments; the script of Aa c respectively Bd e is upside down
between the first and third fragment; nothing to be seen
Or.15004/90 presumably belongs to the same MS

msItem.title: Dharmacakrapravartanasūtra [as an independent single sūtra, part of an anthology or sūtra 379 of the Chinese Saṃyuktāgama (T 99, II 103c13 104a29)]

4 /// .. dapādi • ta[t] (kha)l(u) duḥ .. ///
5 /// + naṃ vidyā(b)ud(dh)[i] + + + ///

msItem.title: Saṃyuktāgama
msItem.note: cf. sūtras 356-358 of the Chinese Saṃyuktāgama (T 99, II 99c22-100a16);to the same folio belongs Or.15004/40
msItem.q:
1 /// + [nirodh](a)g[ām](i)nyāṃ pratipa + ///
2 /// (gāmin)[yā]ṃ pratipa[di] jñānam* i[mā] ///
